Posts.Content: mariar wrote:     I am a recently diagnosed.  I am very fortunate to have a great support team.  I am in the middle of my chemo. treatments.  I have been very fortunate with minimal chemo. side effects (no taste and nausea).  Though, I have felt sad lately.  So, I was wondering if I could hear from stage 3a survivors.  I think it would help me see the light at the end of the tunnel.  I know what I am doing is going to extend my life and make it worthwhile, but I get scared and sad all at once.  So, I thought it help me hear from those special people that have survived this test. Thanks. Dx 7/23/2011, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 1, 5/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: stage 3a breast cancer survivors mariar Icandoallthings

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2011 08:56PM mariar wrote:  It's been really hard lately.   I can't understand why I feel so sad lately.  So, it means alot to hear your story.  I thank you.  Maria

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2011 03:31PM mariar wrote: I appreciate all the positive comments. It helps me to hear from each and everyone. Part of me I think is still in shock. Like so many others, I thought that I was so vigilent with mammograms and ultrasounds, but it wasn't enough. So, it scares me that it can sneak up on you. Keep the survivor list coming. It helps me, and I hope that it helps others.
Posts.Title: stage 3a breast cancer survivors mariar Icandoallthings

Posts.Content: mariar wrote:         I have an achy pain like arthritis pain on my left arm. It goes from top to bottom.  My hand and fingers tingle at times.  I have a port on that side and had a non cancerouse mastetomy on that side.  Does tamoxifen cause this kind of pain?  Can a recurrence cause this kind of pain?  I have had pain for about 3 weeks right after my last 3 month check up.  My blood tests were very good.  Doctor was very happy about my check up.  I just don't know if this is normal.  It seems to slowly be getting better, but it just aches like a growing pain or arthritis.  Any one who has advice, I'd appreciate it. Dx 7/23/2011, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 1, 5/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: arthritis like pain on port side mariar mariar
